text:
A McDonald's seems so out of place here amogst the shi-shi shops on Walnut Street.  That and it is a haven for local down & outs seeking a $1 McChicken and a coke or coffee.

I rarely ever set foot in here. (But admittedly I have once or twice.)

Yick!

I'm sorry - but ANJOU is WEAK!!!

From the outside it looks appealing.  The menu sounds like it's gonna be good - if a bit pricey.

MEH.  MEH. MEH.

Sorry.  Nothing special here.  Go to Pizzicato, Mizu, Uzu or some other nearby place.  There are oodles of them to choose from.

You'd think for a place called "Brodo" that you'd be able to get a decent cup of soup.  Well, you'd be wrong.  I stopped in today after trying to get into Nom Nom (which was mobbed and they don't offer take out.  WTH?  But that's another review...)

Brodo looks very sleek, new and nice.  Prices seem low enough - but it ends there.
I got a 1/2 sandwich (Veggie) and a cup of soup (their version of Italian Wedding).  I asked if I could substitute cheddar for the American Cheese (which is a waste of tasteless fat/calories) and was told they only have shredded cheddar - but i could get swiss or provolone.  So I opted for no cheese.

Meanhwile, I start to eat it back at the office and there is a weird horse-radish taste to the mayo.  I think they goofed and put horseradish mayo on it.  Weird - but not bad.

The soup was salt-laden and NOT even close to being delicious.

Not goin' back.
Sorry.

I spent $8.40 for the combo (no drink).
Oh, and the line waas not bad when I went - but if there is a long line, don't wait in it.  NOT worth it.

So sad, because it looks very nice.  I sure do miss the Naked Chocolate Cafe though.

Read Catherine L.'s review - and my sentiments are echoed.

A close friend and I came here  for dinner.  When we had trouble finding the place (we were at the "A Full Plate" end of Liberties walk, we called on the phone and a nice man came out to get us and walked us over.  This, alas, was the best part of the meal.  Things got progressively worse and worse.

First we were seated (inside - at our request) and our drink order was taken by a clearly overworked, spread-too-thin male server (who was very nice and tried his best - 3 stars for him).

After taking our meal order we waited, and waited, and waited...

And waited some more...

And finally asked harried server to please bring our chips and salsa (as he had just brought some to another table nearby).  We were starvin'!

The smoky salsa and salsa verde arrive - in hot bowls "fresh from the d/w" and thus we had warm salsa.  Yech.  And the salty chips were "chipettes" (or to be mean - crumbs.)  smashed to smithereens.

OK, things aren't so great - but we await our entrees.
Wow - Impressive looking - I order a single beef shortrib and feel like Fred Flintstone.  This thing is HUGE.   Gi-normous!  Like a brontosaurus rib.  Alas - there is no sauce.  My friend orders an "OK" pair of Chicken burritos that are no better than Qdoba.  

So here's the kicker...  About 3/4 through the entrees, frantic server appears again with a six-pack of sauce.  He gives me a bottle of HOT and a bottle of SWEET.  I pour out a bit of the sweet onto my plate (disregarding the crust around the rim of the squeez bottle) and dip my meat in.  UGH!!!  Racidity Central.

The HOT sauce is not rancid - and has a nice flavor but it just to hot for me.

My appetite is now officially GONE.

And shortly thereafter, so were we.  I will not return.

Such a disappointment.

Selection and location 4 stars, Surly/Bitchy customer service - 1 star.
Price 3 stars.

I stopped in here looking for leotards (hopefully something sparkly or USA themed - they had none of that) for my 8 year old's recent gymnastics obsession.

Now, part of this was my own damned fault as I was talking on my cell phone (engrossed actually) as I entered the store and basically waved at the woman and pointed to my phone.  I tried to wrap up the conversationbut the person went on and on and I dd eventually hang up.

By then the woman had wrttenme off - which kinda sucked, because I did end up finding 2 "close-out sale" short sleeved, solid-color, basic leotards at VERY inexpensive prices (and thus non-returnable).

This place is Kickin' it old-skool - literally.
Leos, skirts, ballet shoes, tap shoes, costumey things.
A dancers paradise - save for the surly service.
Glad they are still around - as this type of place is a dying breed.

Do not multi task in this store!!!

Not sure why so many raves.
The place is so dingy and needs a good cleaning.
They do offer many authentic dishes like Duck Tongue and Frog, but we were not interested.

We got the ($32) Peking Duck and the meat was dry.
Eggplant with garlic sauce (the best dish of the night) was so hot we could barely eat it.

Food is very spicy - even dishes marked mild (but that is also part of the Szechuan experience).  Compared to Han Dynasty in Philly - this place is awful.

Not coming back any time soon.

Not good, Temaki.
I am sorry to report that our last visit (albeit it was "Dining Under the Stars" aka "Chaos out in the Heat") the service and food quality both were Just "Meh".

Mike tried hard to please us but after receiving 2 warm and watery diet cokes (they were, thankfully, removed from the bill) and cold, soggy sweet potato tempura rolls - I am not a fan.  Also, this is now the 2nd time the salmon tasted "fishy".  Fresh raw salmon should not taste this way.

Unfortunately for me, my 8 year old ADORES the place - especially the tasty shrimp shumai (served with a saffron cream sauce and fresh sweet corn kernels) and california rolls.

We'll be back - and pray you won't take it out on us, but food and beverage quality needs to improve.

The female manager is very sweet.
I think the guy hates me.  (He might really hate me now.)  

:(

Ook!  I am close to giving it 1 star only.
Dirty, nasty store.  Dairy is unreliable.
Produce is Questionable.

Cashiers?  What Cashiers?  When yo9u can get a register open there is a huge line and the lady looks pissed off.  (I would be too if i had to work here.)

YUCK.

Packaged goods only.
I would never buy veggies, meat or dairy here.

And it's a shame - bordering on a sin.  This area of Philly NEEDS viable grocery stores - and this is all we've got.

SAD, SAD, SAD.

Meh.
You get what you pay for and they do go crazy with the Kewpie Mayo here - so either avoid rolls with mayo or ask for sauces on the side.

I had seen the place (walked by) and read the other yelp reviews - but for $8 (2 maki - you can get 3 for $12) I figured I'd give it a shot.

Service was icy-cold at first (one lady was kinda mean - she was prepping a table for a large party that was not there yet and clearly did not want to stop to help another table) but then my "real" server showed up and was very sweet. Vibe is kinda icy too - with colored LEDlights that change color and rock-hard banquettes that are straight up & down and not that comfortable to sit at.  Water was brought instantly (YAY!) and green tea (which I had to ask for) was free.

I ordered a yellowtail scallion roll (had decent yellowtail but hardly any scallion in it) and a roll with salmon and grilled onions (loaded with mayo blobs on top which I scraped off - seriously, at least 3-4 tsp. of mayo.  Eew).  It was also supposed to have masago but there was NOE in there - and when I asked the (sweet) girl about it she said they don;t include masago on the lunch special.

These people are certainly cost consious - as the lettuce & dressing salad indicated (no tomato, no nothin').

I am in absolutely NO HURRY to come back here - yet - oddly enough - I ran into a friend here with another aquaintance and the LOVE it here.

Meh. Meh. Meeeeeeh.

Sorry.

Doma and Vics cost more - but are sooooo much better.

Nope.

Ok, I came here on the advice of co-workers who basically said "Don't eat at Long River" - which is across the street from my office.

So I trudged over the 2-3 blocks to Golden Chopstick, stood in a pretty long line and ordered a Chicken & Stringbean lunch special with brown rice to go. "Light on the sauce", I implored.

Service was friendly and the order took about 6-8 minutes to come out (not bad considering there were 7 people ahead of me.)

Walked the take-out grub back to my desk and voila.  Tasteless - abut thankfully not greasy due to the lack of sauce.  Beans were the best part - crisp.  Chicken (thankfully white meat) was bone dry and flavorless.

Not sure If I'd ever come back.

Now I am really in fear of Long River.  This is supposed to be the "good" Chinese place near my office.

Oh well.

This ain't my bag, baby.
The free one hour of "build your own" martinis was great - for FREE - and then it was $5.00 apiece after 9 PM.

My husband got completely hammered by downing 3 of the candy garnished concoctions is 55 minutes.

It was just way too frat-boy in there - and the lack of waitress servce made it impossible for us to even order food.  (Thus we were both pretty trashed while drinking on an empty stomach.)

The cute bartender-boy made me a very tasty cosmo - but I was just as happy with my cranberry, vodka & lime.

If it were not for the "free" ploy marketing - we'd never have gone in.

And unless there's another freebie - we won't return.

Such a shame - years ago this was THE place and had shopping and a great food court.  Now it is so dead here. And too many t-shirt/key chain vendors.

Sigh...

OK, for some reason I could not get the name "Beefsteak Charlie's" out of my mind - and indeed, this place takes me back to 1984 - but not in a good way.

The good parts?  Our server Brian was attentive and kind - and took the overly-salted French Onion Soup off our tab without hesitation - nor us asking.

The salad bar is also nice - and very '80's - one whole section is mayonaie-based salads (pasta, potato) so I skipped that part.

My friend ordered a "Queen Cut" prime rib - and I had 2 bites of it - he ordered it medium and it actually came out rarer than I had thought it would.  It was OK but no flavor to it other than (you guessed it) salt.

Do NOT order the French Onion Soup here - it looks great and the cheese/crouton are good - but the beef stock is like eating a salt lick.  I could not eat more than a few spoonfuls ($4.99) what a shame!

Just OK.  Not in a hurry to go back.
Strangely enough - with the exception of no "pick and peek" shrimp on the salad bar and no "Free Sangria" (remember that???) this place could be a Beefsteak Charlie's.

Ah, the '80's.
Childhood.
Recaptured.

I guess...

Nope.  Now we go tot he Giant in Aston which is far better - albeit more crowded.

This Giant has out of date dairy products (have seen that twice now - so READ THE DATES!!!) and a picked-over produce department.

Step up your game, Giant in Brookhaven!

Meh.  2.15 for a bottle of Dasani?  I shoulda gotten a latte for $2.19 instead.

Mediocrity at its best.

I am so NOT a fan of Cosi.  After eating in them in NYC in the early 2000's when this chain emerged - it seemed cool at first.  And - if the bread is fresh and hot (before it solidifies into cold cardboard) it actually tastes pretty good.

The hungrier you are the better it'll taste.

Meanwhile - the overpriced sandwich fillings are mediocre at best.
There are better places to waste (I mean spend) $9 bux.

Sorry.  Not a big fan.

Well, I got dragged back to "the pube" for a free event for a charity that I support.

While I love the charity and am thankful to the Public House for sponsoring the event, the food and beverage service here is sub par.
Mediocre chicken wrap (with an odd mayo-ish sauce) was inedible.

Hummus and veggies were safe - but blah.

It's still not my thing.

Sorry - but i have had way, way, way better Afghan food.  I love Afghan food - the bread is usually sooooo good.  Sansom's was dry and re-heated in a toaster oven.

The rice (reheated as well) was good, but not great.

The salad - scooped out of a tupperware - obviously pre-prepped way in advance was wilted and over dressed.

The Chalaw Kadu (Normally a fave) was so greasy I had to pick out the chunks of pumkpin from the sauce and discard it.

I was the ONLY person in here on a Thursday night - and finally another single diner came in.  The place was dead - and I bet I know why.
Get it together, folks.

I'm sticking with Kabul. (And oh, how I miss Pamir - now closed - in NYC)

We had mediocre service from the "internet car" guy (there are 2 people dedicated to web-based pricing) and test drove a Ford Fusion.  Nice car - but we wound up purchasing a Hyundai instead.

Not a great dealership.
Not overly impressed.

Well, Jay was not here tonight and I bet he'd freak if he was.
The place has gone downhill - and quickly.

My tuna dumplings were stuffed with Kani Salad (fake crab) not lobster as shown on the menu.  The weird, overbearing, barely-english-speaking waitress leaned in sooooo close to me it was a BIG violation of my personal space.  To top it off, she cleared my plates and brought a check - assuming I was done.  I was actually contemplating ordering 1 more roll or a piece or something - but i was so put off, I just paid the bill and left.

The 2 sushi guys behind the counter were friendly enough - but they were so busy filling takeout orders (dead for eat-in, busy for take-out) that their work was just SLOPPY.

I am unimpressed, Jay.  Get it back together!  You have some great items on the menu.  They need to be executed better - less kani stick and more REAL seafood, please.

I came here out of sheer desperation and they carry Eukeneuba small breed senior.
What I noticed - the place smells AWFUL and there are tons of puppies and PIGS ($399) for sale.

This ain't right!
Stop supporting puppy mills.

2 young adults (late teens?) seemed to be running the place.

I generally hate Cosi - the bread is like hot cardboard - and the food is not my thing, but I stop in to this one every once in a while for iced coffee.  A good friend lives near this one so we'll meet here, grab some iced coffee and hang out with or without our kids in tow.

The restroom is abhorently filthy though.  Yick.

I am so not a Cosi fan.
The bread tastes like stale cardboard a minute after it cools - and g-d know what its doing inside my stomach.

The prices are high as are the caloric contents.

This particular location - inside 30th Street - is often crowded and the service is awful.

Not my thing, baby - and 2 stars is being nice.

OK - there are many, many things wrong with La Creperie - but I will start with the positives.

1.  Our server Christine - was incredibly sweet, attentive and accurate. 4 stars for her! 
2.  The actual crepe itself is tasty - not too greasy nor too dry and is made of white flour (not buckwheat which the true Breton crepes are made).
3.  Our large party of 8 was accomodated with separate checks

OK where to start on the bad stuff.

1.  The ancient rattan chairs are incredibly uncomfortable.  So much so, that I had to switch to a wooden chair (there are a few available so try to sit at a table with the cheap wood chairs).

2.  They got my order wrong (A salade Le Melange with no onion and fresh tomato subbed for sundried).  Once corrected the fresh tomatoes were rotten and tasted so bad that I could not eat the salade.

3.  The prices are INSANE for the quality.  My Lemon & Sugar crepe was $6.75 - which is OBSCENE.  The rotten tomato salade was $12.  That's over $20 when you add tip & tax for a salade and a dessert crepe - no beverage.

4.  The restaurant was dead-empty except for our large party of 8 from when we arrived at 7:00 until after 9:30 when we left.  (This could be viewed as a pro and con in one.)  I think there is a REASON people are not coming here.

Yes the quality is better than "crepe maker" in 30th Street station - but the crepes at Profi's in Reading Terminal Market as just as good, way cheaper and (if you can deal with crowds 7 stools) possibly just as comfortable of an atmosphere.

My next stop with be Beau Monde (who's prices are even HIGHER) for true Breton crepes.  I pray I am not disappointed.

Sorry La Creperie, but ya let me down.

Save for Christine.  She's been there 3 years - one night a week - and she is terrific.  She even adjusted my bill for the inedible salade.  (I feel so very French spelling salad with an "e").

I hear this place is owned by Chau (Nail by Chau around the corner - which I used to go to quite often for manis only).  This place is downright grungy.

Went here twice for manis.  No way I'd get a pedi here.

You get what u pay for!

A true CLASSIC dive-bar - but luckily the low, low prices ($4.95 for a patty melt - no fries) and decent "greasy short order" cookery match the dated '70's décor.

Gretchen is a great bartender and the locals all gather round to down a few beers and grab a quick smoke out back.

NOT a yuppy-Media-bar at all.
This is one of the TRUE Media originals.
Family owned - great customers and low-brow food and décor.

Just what I need when I want a CHEAP drink.

Went in to get passport pictures taken.
Their camera was broken.

I left and went to Walgreen's nearby.

Well, Jay was not here tonight and I bet he'd freak if he was.
The place has gone downhill - and quickly.

My tuna dumplings were stuffed with Kani Salad (fake crab) not lobster as shown on the menu.  The weird, overbearing, barely-english-speaking waitress leaned in sooooo close to me it was a BIG violation of my personal space.  To top it off, she cleared my plates and brought a check - assuming I was done.  I was actually contemplating ordering 1 more roll or a piece or something - but i was so put off, I just paid the bill and left.

The 2 sushi guys behind the counter were friendly enough - but they were so busy filling takeout orders (dead for eat-in, busy for take-out) that their work was just SLOPPY.

I am unimpressed, Jay.  Get it back together!  You have some great items on the menu.  They need to be executed better - less kani stick and more REAL seafood, please. 
.

Need to clean the restrooms, aisles and seats.
GROSS.

This is the Perkins where my then-unemployed friend and I (in our late teens) experienced that great grease-fest of '90.  We ordered a fried appetizer combo of mozz. stix, chicken things and other fried stuff.

And coffee.

Lots of coffee and cigarettes.  (You USED to be able to smoke in a pancake house, but alas, no more.)

What a regrettable meal.
I shoulda just had pancakes.

Oh, this poor mall.
The era of the American circa 1983 mall is over.

It's a shame, too - because it's so close by - and we will be coming here for the few restaurants and shops that are left - and the movie theatre.

I hope they can revive it.

Hate to be a nay-sayer - but I don;t know how this place stays in business - there are way cheaper sources for cookbooks and many places like Amazon, Half.com and ebay for used copies.

I rarely buy new books anymore - especially a true cook book which will get beat up and spattered on in my kitchen.

I am glad they exist and love to browse here - but I buy elsewhere.
Sad but true and I wish the (very pleasant) owner luck.  SOmehow they have lasted.  Not sure how.

MEH!  So Meh-diocre.  A casino usually has great food. Not at Sugarhouse.  It has middle-of-the-road burgers and a few snadwiches and plates.

Not my bag, baby.

Honestly?  Were it not for proximity - I would NEVER come to Sugarhouse - I'd sooner go to AC or even Bethlehem, PA.

Philly fought long & hard to get a casino - and THIS is what they get?

Sorry - Unimpressed.

I won't be returning to Coco anytime soon.
I stopped in at 7:45 AM this morning after passing by many times and seeing the sign advertising over 6 different kinds of soup.

I figured that soup would not be available in the early AM - but the lady said that it was if I really wanted it and what kind would I like?

I settled on a small Chicken & Dumpling soup.
After a while she brought out a styrofoam bowl from the kitchen and asked me, "Do you want that heated up"?

What?  Are you kidding me?  "Yes, of course".
(I was thinking, what?  I'm gonna eat cold soup?)

Whatever.

Meanwhile the one male cashier was very, very cute.
The soup itself was fine - not mind blowing but certainly not worth a rush back.

Service here is just plain odd.

I will not be back.

Ugh.  Don't get me started on O.G. - and this one in particular is where 2 out of 3 of my DH's brothers had their wedding rehearsal dinners.

Thus, my (then future) FIL wanted US to have our rehearsal dinner there too.  NO WAY!!!  (We wound up going to Bensi's across the street).

Meanwhile - O.G is NOT Italian.  It's faux-talian-american.  And it's full of kids.

I am not a fan of the over cooked, over sauce formula-cooked pastas.
It's OK in a pinch but there are so many way better choices.

So expensive and such a snotty vibe.
The best part is the boutique upstairs, but basically I was given dirty looks by the sales ladies the entire time i shopped.

Whatever.

My friend and I went and it was a disaster.  They got the orders totally wrong, and the place was not even busy.  Yes, they are new, yes they are pricey and the turkey burger I had was tasty - but the customer service was very, very bad.  I don't think they will make it.

Seriously old and old-school.  In need of a toal property makeover (and not to mention the crappy diner next door which I think is now out of biz.).  Rooms are basic and OLD. 

Ook.

Not a top choice - but it's the only choice in this immediate area in Delaware County.

please wash the comforter covers.  They look so bad.  Maybe replace them?

Ok, maybe I am in a bad mood.  I am at a toss up between 2 and 3 stars.
My "joey Bag of Donuts" chicken burrito was dry and I just didn't like the food here as much as Baja Fresh, Qdoba or Chipotle.

It sure seems like "Fast Mex Food" is all the rage these days.

I'd come back here - but not in a hurry.

And the guacamole tasted too sour.  (89 cents for a tiny side of it.)

2 - 3 star sushi (and teppanyaki/hibachi tables in the back) with over-load of sauces (get the sauce on the side) and mediocre fish.  Seemed fresh enough but obviously frozen tamago and others. I actually got sick after I ate it.  This might go to a 1 star review if I can figure out for sure that my gastric distress was from the fish.

Not a holy grail - but for $8.95 ($1 extra for ONE specialy maki) for the 2 maki lunch - with Miso Soup and Salad - it's OK.

I had a yellowtail scallion roll and the "Rose" roll - spicy tuna inside with tuna on top.

Not Great.
In my opinion, Sushi Nami down the street is better.
And the place was so cold inside.  (Hot green tea helped warm us up.)

Back in "the day" I would occaisionally grab a bite to eat at Houston Hall when I was a grad student at PENN.  (That was, indeed, more than a few years back).

Mostly fast food options - but also a bagel place and a salad place.

Just OK - but convenient when you are on campus.

OK.  I have to tell you that I DID NOT GET TO ACTUALLY EAT HERE.  So I can not comment on the food - who friends and colleagues tell me is great. I have also been told that when they screw up, they screw up in a big way.  Well they screwed up today.

 I am rating Sabrina's on the abysmal way in which I was treated this morning at 9:40 AM.  Yes - on Saturday AM's the place gets slammed - but I was BY MYSELF - solo - and could have easily been greeted and asked to sit at the counter which had 4 open stools.  Since it was before 10 (don't even think about coming at 11 on a weekend) there were even 2 tables open (where the 2 other parties got seated.)

Nevertheless the host ignored me and proceeded to seat the party before (natch) and after me and NEVER GREETED me.  

I pulled a menu off of the pile on the host/hostess stand and read it for a few minutes (sounded good- medium to high prices).  Still nothing.

I just said "screw it" and left.

I hope to actually get a chance to eat here in the future.  I guess singles aren't too welcome here.  Next time I'll bring my adorable 4 year old.  I bet we'll get seated.

"I agree wholeheartedly .
This IS the UK version of TGI Friday's.

And it's pretty Meh.  The fried fish & chips and decent - but predictably greasy and salty.

The food is bland, boring "formula" cooking and the staff are pretty bored with it all."

What a disappointment!

I had not been to the CH Mall since the late '80's and boy - considering it is under construction - it sure needs the overhaul.

The food court (supposedly brand new) was so new that it had only 2 stores - and 1 was Orange Julius.  We wound up eating at the "Bistro" which is like a little diner in the middle of the mall.  (They serve pizza, too.)

They had a Build-aBear workshop, Sephora and alot of "average" chain stores.

There is a brand new Crate & Barrel (big) and "The" Container Store on the property.

Kinda sad to see how dead that mall was on a Wednesday night in August.

I hope the construction doesn't KILL their holiday sales.

OMG - horrible.
Stay away.

Disinterested service that does not acknowledge when you walk in.
Cheap, but overly fried and greasy food (Lunch combos are all under $6).

I drank my 85 cent diet coke and threw most of my fried (They would not make it for me steamed even though I asked) tofu and broccoli.

Brown rice (they do have it - probably a big mistake) was gluey.

1 star for food but 4 star service from our 2 female servers and the chic Manager on Duty.
We had a private part for 10 on a Sunday for lunch,

My food was inedible but the other folks snarfed theirs down.
So salty/oily (Shrimp Scampi) and even though I asked for the pasta to be cooked al dente, I do not think they know the meaning of those words.

Not a fan and never will be.
My in-laws family loves it here for whatever reason so every year or two I get dragged along.

This is NOT Italian food.  This is formula cooking administered by college kids.

Nope.   Fail.  
They carry the Eukeneuba my pooch prefers but at nearly $3 per bag more.
Even with a 15% off coupon I still paid more that at Delchester Feed.

I have one more coupon - this one is for $5 off a bag - and if they honor it i will use it, get my Eukeneuba and not return.

Overpriced!

Oy, vey!  It's Finneys.  How many underaged drinks did I get here? (Way, way back in the day?)

How many of my high shcool friends got completely and utterly $h@!-faced here?

How many busts occured here?

How many joints were snuck in the bathroom (or out back?)

How many ancient buzzed or dunken memories have been through these hallowed doors?

This place was one of the ONLY liquor-licensed bars in D-town for YEARS (before D-town became yuppieville and a certified tourist destination - BWAH-HA-HA).

When I was growing up here we had Finney's and the Farm House - and the Amber Inn (which was called something else - I can't remember) and a few other seedy bars.

Finney's is, indeed, as Erin R. writes a "frat party" atmosphere - and also your basic townie bar.  But it kept us good and liquored up all thru Jr. High and High School and for that I am grateful.  (Mom, are you reading this???)

Affectionately known as Charbucks or Fourbucks - we have adopted the slogan of:

"Friends don't let friends drink starbucks."

Save money by brewing at home with Peregrine Coffee (the BEST) or go to La Colombe or Caffeination.

OK, I'm gonna be nice and give them 2 stars - as usually McDonald's by it's very nature is a one star chain for me. 

I don't do fast food.  I just don't - but if you need a clean(ish) restroom - and the new McCafe coffee - the New Britain (old school) mcD's has been around for-eh-ver.

I think it may be about the same vintage as the Doylestown location.

The people working here are pleasant, though and that is worth alot.  Mostly CB West folks, some young adults - some not-so-young (during the day shift).

I won't be in often, but hey - it's there.

Not a fan.  Sorry.  With Qdoba nearby and really GOOD places like Xochitl and Tequila's, I guess I am forever spoiled.  Even my former experience with San Francisco tacquerias puts Hot Tamales to shame.

I had a burrito with spinach, mushrooms and supposedly turkey - but it seemed almost exactly the same as the ground beef my friend ordered.  Weird.  And bland.  And just not that tasty.

It's not that the food is dangerous or anything - it's just not that good.
It is cheap, however.  And crowded at lunch time (I thnk they are closed at dinner time.)

Whatever.

Not really worth the energy.

It's OK.  Just OK.  I grabbed a quick low-fat banana berry muffin ($2.00 including tax) and the lady heated it up in the microwave for me.

With so many other goodies in RTM - this might be OK if you need BREAD - but for sammies or treats I'd go elsewhere (Like Flying Monkey for treats or Olympia Gyro).

But I guess that's not an apples to apples comparisson.

It may be intangible, but I was never thrilled with le Bus.  Very 1989.

It's here - and that's a BIG plus.  I just bought a 1/2 gallon of tropicana OJ there - i was in a pinch and HAD to have it - and it was $4.49.  OUCH!

I also got a 12 oz. bottle of V-8 for $1.99 - Double OUCH!

Korean-run and nice staff, but wow - so pricey.  They also have a hot food bar that looks so unappetizing to me.

Glad they are here - wish they were cleaner and cheaper.

Otto's dumpy brauhaus has been around for years & years & years - as long as I can remember.  I went twice over the years and both were pretty bad - but I am not a "wurst" gal.

You can drink yourself silly with the NUMEROUS beers on tap and in bottles.  (Alas, I am not a beer gal either) You can watch the game, ogle the dusty old busts of deer on the walls or count the multi-colored beer steins hanging on the walls.

It's just not that great.  The food is mediocre at best and some of the servers (who've worked there for eons) just really don't care any more.

If you LIKE German food - then go, otherwise I'd skip it.

Meh.
Decent staff helping us or trying to sell us a new phone.

Not gonna buy here, I don't think.

A decent selection of high priced phones.
Just OK.  Meh is the perfect word to describe the S&HF.  Been around a long time though so SOMEBODY must be going there.  Years & Years ago it was a meh pizzeria.  This location is cursed.

Mediocrity.  Came here when I was in a huge rush and Hip City Veg (next door) was bustling and Nom Nom ramen had a long line.  Spent about $6 on a latte and a stale bagel with veggie "light" cream cheese, tomato and cucumber.

Bitter overpriced latte.  

BLAH.

Waste of calories.

Not goin' back.

This Mickey-D's has been on Sugan road for years and years.  I rarely stop in (I don;t "do" fast food) unless dragged in by a friend or relative.  But - they have clean (relatively) bathrooms and that has saved us on occaision.

Meh.  Just like the ones in NYC - over priced but quck and convient with food that looks better than it tastes.

And $3.50 for a small bowl of lettuce (add ingredients to make a salad) is robbery!

And my egg bagel was flavorless and slightly stale.

Won't be back.

It's a dive bar, it's cheap - and  it can be fun.
I attended a large company party there - and we had blast - and some folks got good and blasted themselves.

Dan is a charmer - and Liz, our server was terrific.
Food was just Meh, (Extremely salty green beans (frozen), overcooked rice, and average meatballs.

But dive bars just ain't my thang.

P.S.  They are remodelling soon so it may improve things,

Doesn't do a damned thing for me.  But it is CHEAP and you can get sammies, burgers and FRIED pub grub here for a quick lunch or a beer after work.

Maybe I am too snooty-snotty for this, but I am not a fan.

Surprisingly the service we had here (dine in) was good.
DD - our 8 year old - had a certificate for a free personal pizza for being a good reader in school, so we indulged her and she got a cute (tiny) pie with black olives.

She was fine.

I tried a pasta dish.
Drowning in a tasteless greasy sauce.

Fail.

It's not happening again.
Sorry.

If you like pizza hut pizza - this location is relatively well-run and has a dine-in area that is pleasant.  Order the (grease-laden) pan pizza, bring the kiddies and DINE IN - for fresher tasting pies.

Big flat-screen TVs broadcast "the game".
I guess we really, truly live in the 'burbs now.

Yawn...

Love Park would be great save for the numerous homeless and addicts that congregate there.  My little daughter loves the fountain and to run around it and the LOVE statue.  The water in the fountain is seriously gross.  (Probably from said homeless people bething and peeing in it.)

Wish Philly could address these types of problems better.
There seem to be more homeless and addicts here than even in NYC. (At least here they are more visible and aggressive.)

A dreadful branch of Rite-Aid.
A neccessary evil.

Clueless cashiers - and never enough of them, thus lines form.

They do have many convenience items, however, so for that - it's OK.

But this one is truly MEH.

This is not a great place to shop - but sometimes when I need kids clothes in a pinch, it is a convenient place to go.  You really have to search and dig (and I mean really dig) thru the rumpled, disorganized merchandise.  Toddler sizes mixed in w/ babies - oh and there's a size 12 "big girl".  What's that doing there?

Who knows.

Don't ask the staff - their not around - only at the under-manned chechouts.

Not a fave - but as I said -in a pinch I can get kiddie stuff here.

It's not as good as I'd hoped nor as bad as I'd feared.
Potbelly is a fast-food sandwichs chain with decent prices and an EXTREMELY limited menu.

I had a Chicken Salad salad that was passable.  I had them add artichoke hearts and remove the dried cranberries.
Though I am not thrilled I prefer it to Quizno's and Subway.

Line moved quickly and servers were well trained and fairly friendly.  (But THAT's because they are new.) I am certain that quality will diminish over time, as most fast food places (and manicure joints) do.

While we have gotten some good deals at Best Buy (the chain) - this particular store is NOT fun to shop in.  

Crowded, often Crazy lines, sub-par customer service.
But - you can snag a Flat-screen TV, Smartphone, Digital Camera or laptop for a very cheap price here when ther are running a deal.

AVOID at Xmas time.

So disappointed with our take-out order from Chin's - which is pretty much the "only game in town" for D-town Chinese nowadays.

The spare-ribs were burnt and just plain bad - we threw one away (You get 5 for $8/95.  The pepper steak with onion was loaded with onion and very little beef - although what was there tasted great. 

The best part was the house special fried rice - made to order and very good but man, everything else was not great this time.

What happened?
Chin's is our go-to and we'd hate to stop going.

Finney's is a D-town original - and one of the few liquor licenses in town.
I "dive-bar" feel with lots of regulars some of which have been coming here for 30 - 40 years.

Brings back so many memories.

Not a happy camper.
Went to El Rey at 4:40 PM - was told no dinner until 5 - but we could have a drink and chips & salsa ($3.50 - very tasty).

I ordered what i always get - the classic margarita.  Ugh - it was so bitter.
I asked them to re-make it, explaining that it tasted unusually bitter.  they remade it - and it tasted the same - dreadful.  They remade it a second time and it was good - but not the smooth, limey-sweetness that it usually is.  So I drank it.

I got fish tacos ($9 for 3 tacos) and they are the exact same tiny tacos you get for $1 during happy hour - no rice or beans or anything with them.  So I got a side order of corn on the cob (good stuff!).

I am sticking to happy hour here from how on.
My husband will stick with Qdoba.

No good.  The dumplings are doughy and not good at all.
Get your dumplings from Sang Kee right down the aisle.

We came here at 5:45 PM (RTM closes at 6 PM) and Sang Kee had already pretty much shut down and the little one HAD to have dumplings and even she said, "Mommy, I don;t like these.  I want Sang Kee."

Smart 5 year old.

That said, the (female) owner was really, really nice to us.
It's a shame the dumplings were so heavy & mystery-meatish.

I was a Big OS catalog customer (website) back in tha day, so I went in to see if I could get some bone-in 14 oz. Strips.

There were 2 other customers and a delivery man ion the store all waiting to be helpeed.

So I browsed around a bit and left.
Meh customer Service.
I will order online if I need help quickly.

This location is gonna die.
Horrible Parking lot.

Nope.
Unimpressed.

Yes, it's inexpensive but you are MUCH better off going 1/2 a block down the street to the Asian (Vietnamese) place or across the street for Oasis Lebanese.

We stopped in because the Vietnamese place was closed and we figured we'd check it out.  Both of us had $9.95 bento lunch boxes and mine (Salmon Basil) was not good at all.  Frozen and fishy tasting salmon that was DEEP FRIED (Ick.).  I ate the other stuff.  
Miso soup was fine.  $2.00 up charge for Thai Chicken Coconut soup insteadof Miso (also good).

Not a fan.  Sorry.

OMG - it's still here!
This is the Taco Bell from my childhood - and it has been renovated a couple of times since the '90's.

Not a big T-bell fan - but in a pinch, it's here.
I avoid fast food whenever possible.

This place is kinda depressing.
Server, Rae, was nice - and attentive.
Place was nearly empty on a Monday night.

Salad that came with the meal was pretty bad - lettuce was overly wet, cut into tiny pieces and starting to rust (turn brown).  The 2 slices of tomato and 2 sliced of un-peeled waxy cucumber were at least edible.  The supposedly home-made russian dressing was just awful (thank goodness I ordered it on the side).

The entree itself was OK - veal francese (I know!  What possessed me -next time, if there is a next time as I am not prone to return, I will get a gyro or pancakes or something "easier").  Surprisingly good.  3 stars even - but the salad skeeved me.

Ugly interior - but at least they seem to be re-doing the ladies room.

As I said, I will not rush back.  I much prefer the court diner.

This place is kinda depressing.
Server, Rae, was nice - and attentive.
Place was nearly empty on a Monday night.

Salad that came with the meal was pretty bad - lettuce was overly wet, cut into tiny pieces and starting to rust (turn brown).  The 2 slices of tomato and 2 sliced of un-peeled waxy cucumber were at least edible.  The supposedly home-made russian dressing was just awful (thank goodness I ordered it on the side).

The entree itself was OK - veal francese (I know!  What possessed me -next time, if there is a next time as I am not prone to return, I will get a gyro or pancakes or something "easier").  Surprisingly good.  3 stars even - but the salad skeeved me.

Ugly interior - but at least they seem to be re-doing the ladies room.

As I said, I will not rush back.  I much prefer the Court diner or the new Aston Diner

Meh.xican Post.
Meh.

Bleh.

Blech?

I love the peom the lady wrote.  The service and noise level are just awful.  And yes, this is gringo-philly-mex.  How I miss my Gordo Tacqueria in CA.  In philly I like Xochitl or Tequilas (both are pricey and haute-mex - not taco joints.)

When, oh WHEN will we get a good taqueria in Center City?  And, no, Qdoba does not count.

Not as bad as it could have been but not great either.
I attended a conference here - ate the "banquet food" (Meh) in cramped dining rooms (The room downstairs claims to seat 150 and that is too tight.) with disinterested servers who could not wait to finish their shifts and get the heck out.

"Grab & Go" breakfast was a joke.  Awful  100% pre-packaged foods.

Room seemed OK but now I am paranoid about bedbugs.  Surprisingly, bathroom (in hotel room) looked as though it had been renovated.  Public restroom was a high trafic area and needed re-stocking moreoften than it got.
Will let you know.

OK - please note that this scathing review (I was tempted to go with 1 star - but I am sure the food is great.) is based on what happened to me here about 3 moths ago.

I pass by Pastoral every week on my way home from Pilates - and one night decided to go in and give it a try.

The place was dead empty (It had to be a Tuesday ot Thursday - as those were Pilates nights) save for one lone couple having dinner.

I was not greeted and sat myself at an empty table that seated 4 but had 2 places set.  A few minutes later a man chucked a menu at me and muttered something about another person coming (no, just me) and a $15.00 minimum.

I just got really turned off and walked out.  I felt bad about walking out - but he really weireded me out.

So I never got to eat here and now I know I will never go back there alone.  Maybe if a friend wants to go.  I could use some good Kalbi and Mandoo.

They treat me nicer at Miran.

So far I am not impressed - but I will let you know once I get my ORDER BACK.
I usually drop my drycleaning off at a place on 452 called Victory - and they have been great - in on Monday, back on Tuesday (They also have same day service but I have not tried t).

This place - I dropped off on Tuesday and the guy (who was very hard to understand) who was swamped with bags of clothes (Place looks very disorganized), had me type my own name and address into his computer.  (Weird)

Then he said - "when do you need it?"  So I said, "when would it normally be ready?"
 and he replies, Saturday.  He sensed I did not like that answer and then quickly changed it to Friday.

So tomorrow is Friday - we'll see if my stuff is ready.
Also his prices are higher than Victory.  I doubt I'll be coming back after tomorrow.

This place has never really done it for me - although co-workers like it here and Catering uses them for decent - if uninsprired "Faux"-sher (Kosher) sammies.

The tuna on rye I had was a little dry - which I suppose is better than too much mayo.  (Yick.)  It can get very busy at lunch time.

I did enjoy the pickle assortment - but it still ain't like a real NY deli.

Absolute mediocrity - but hey, it's cheap and quick.  But - BLargh!  Do not eat the over-salted, plastickly mac & cheese.  Corned Beef is also a salt-pile.

Not a fan - and not goin' back unless dragged (as I was today) by a co-worker.

#BrownBaggingIsBetter

An enormous space that is sparsely populated with hockey gear, skates and accessories (Sadly, no goalie gear).  Also no figure skating gear.  

They will skarpen skates for $7.

Service was icy cold - maybe because I came in alone?
Not in any hurry to return as I have a figure skater - not a hockey player.

I am NOT an Outback fan - and this location is no exception.  I was dragged along for a family birthday celebration - and the person who's birthday it was is on Atkins and can only eat big hunks of meat.

So here we go - we had a party of 7 - and were seated right away because we can at 4:40 PM - otherwise I can only image how long a wait would have been on a busy Saturday night.

Service was absolutely fine - but the ladies room was HORRIBLE.  I told a guy in the bar area about the trash on the floor and they cleaned it up right away.

As for the "formulaic" food - it was edible.  Not good but not inedible.
I had a rib-eye steak (asked for it without the salt-lick seasoning they usually use - I have learned my lesson from past salt-lick-steak experiences). Added a grilled lobster tail for $11.95.  Seriously?  This this was barely 2.5 ounce.  I could have had a bunch of shrimp for a fraction of the cost.

Anyhow - I also got a naked sweet potato as a side (not brown sugar - and the giant lump of butter came along side.)

Our 11 year old got a salad topped with grilled shrimp (again sans seasoning - as it is just too salty for our family's tastes).  She said - and I quote she felt, "unsatisfied".

Unsatisfied - that is just about the perfect way to describe our experience.

Blargh!

Well, at least Philly HAS a SEPTA.  After living in SF, DC and NY it is so disappointing to have such limited schedules and services as in SEPTAS Regional Rail (could they PLEASE add more departures from Doylestown on the R5 during rush hour??).

I also take the Trolleys, Market El and Broad Street Line - and the stink is just horrible.  

I am willing to pay more for better service.  Philly needs it.

This location is in the Gallery - so it gets downgraded from the 3 stars I would normally give to an ON by default. The dis-interested, underpaid staff has a distinctly "ghetto" vibe here - but all in all you can still get mass-produced, el-cheapo disposable clothing here.

I very rarely get anything for myself at ON - the snooty law firm folks I work with could sniff that out in a minute.  Instead, I lavish my pre-schooler with $5.00 sneakers and 2 for ten jammy sets.  Oh and socks - love the cheap socks.

I'd skip Geno's and walk around the corner to Pat's - or better yet - go to Jim's.
Or Tony Luke's.
Or Pastificio's for the real deal.

Let me just add that I am NOT a cheessteak eater - I get a Chicken Cheesesteak 'wit Provolone and 'shrooms once or twice a year.

Geno's is filthy and to quote below - the owner is a racially prejudiced "ass clown".

Olive Garden is Faux-talian-American and is really not that great.
My inlaws insist on going to chain restaurants like this, Buca di Beppo, Romano's Macaroni' Grill (how the heck do you grill Macaroni??) and other sub-par poser-Talian chains.

Meanwhile, my 3 year old loves it here - so there's no accounting for taste.
And it used to be cheap - but no longer.  I had a so-so shrimp scampi (angel hair here is a definite AVOID - ads it is always overcooked and mushy.) and it was $16.95.

The unlimited iceberg & white-bread (Oh, sorry, I meant salad & grease-sticks) are a big turn on to college kids and cheap in-laws alike.

For my time & money - there are FAR better places to go (even in the spectra of Faux-talian chains.) [See my review of Bensi's]

What problems!  What hassle - the cecutiry lines are miles long.
Better allow for lots of extra time.

The parking costs a bundle (as with all airports) and once inside the shopping is mediocre and over-priced. ($3.00 for bottled water???)
They have you TRAPPED.

Supposedly an airport "spa" is set to open.  Maybe that will help.

The bathrooms also need more frequent cleaning.

And don't even get me started about holiday travel.  Ugh!!!!!

No.
Just No.

Came here for Dining Under the Stars because we knew they'd have a table (and here's why).
Food is Meh and service is confused and chaotic.

Forgot to write down our order on a check thus we never got a check and had to TELL them what we got.  Then it took a while to actually pay.

Meanwhile people are waiting for our (now coveted outdoor) table.

Pad Thai (Chicken) was good - yes, it was.
Tom Kha was average.

Bathroom is gross.

They need to step up their game or they won;t be around many more years.

I am not and have never been a 7-11 person, however, I was desperate. Stopped in on a Saturday morning before 9 AM and the place was empty.  Bought a few low carb snack items, paid the friendly (owner? Manager?) cashier and left.

No issues.

This is a pretty sub-par Rite Aid - but at least it exists.  I was pretty close to giving it 1 star, but decided to be kind.  Disinterested staff, high urban prices.  Needs help, but I am glad they are around in a pinch.

Just OK - I had a salad bowl and the cucumber salad and baba ghanouj were fine - the rest (hummus, limp romaine, dry chicken and tough-mediocre "steak") was edible but blah.

Do not get the steak.  Not at all juicy.

I love this type of food and have tried 2 other local mini chains Naya and Cava and they were both better than Naf Naf.

I wanted to love it but it is just Meh.

That said they staff greeted me upon entrance (I came in early before the long-ass line)  and the cashier was very friendly and polite.

Might try it again but might now.
This used to be Genuardi's, now it's a Weis.  It's fine.  Not the worst and not the greatest - still better than Acme and not as good as Giant.

I have come here a few times and on 2 occasion now they have gotten my drink order wrong.
Both times they fixed it right away though.

One time they gave me regular when I asked for decaf and I could feel it right away - wow.  What a jolt!

The 'Bux in Paoli is way better.

Affectionately known as Charbucks or Fourbucks - we have adopted the slogan of:

"Friends don't let friends drink starbucks."

Save money by brewing at home with Peregrine Coffee (the BEST) or go to La Colombe or Caffeination.

I loathe fast food - so when my fast-food eating spouse (and newly indoctrinated child) demand frosties - we stopped here.

My bad.

Meanwhile, the food was (the usual unhealthy) edible.
This place is very "old school" in decor and could use a makeover.

Do not try the "new" homestyle mac 'n cheese - swimming in velveeta-like goo.
YUCK.

Salad greens were not so fresh.

Hamberger was fine (the same ole, same ole).
Oh - and I asked said 7-year-old if the chicken sandwich was better here or at Chik-Fil-A she empatically declared Chik-Fil-A the winner.  But she loves those darned frosties.

For less than $15 for 3 people to eat?  CHEAP.
But - you get what you pay for.  I never recommend eating fast food.
UGGH!

Coffee shop - only open in the mornings and early afternoon (thus never whenI am there.)

Parking lot is big but fills up EARLY with commuters.

A few benches outside to wait for the train when the station is closed.
It's OK.  Just Meh.

You can get really nice stones from Blue Nile instead and have your own jeweler set them.  Yes, Tiff's has quality - but you PAY (dearly) and overly for it.

It's kinda like McDiamonds.

Not very good.  My daughter ordered take out from here twice - she liked the wings - but now we prefer the Vine Street branch of Wings to Go.

The salads are not fresh here.  Sorry.

Oh - and get to-go (take out) it's depressing to eat here and small.

A neccessary evil - especially living in the "hub" pf Philadelphia.
I try to take Southwest whenever I can - but sometimes I gotta do US Air.

Coach is, indeed, horrendous.

Took my little one here for the $12 haircut.
We usually go to the SuperCuts in Philly - different owner/franchise.

This one the lady did not cut the hair short enough.  I asked for the bangs to be shorter. She told me not to go any shorter because it would be shorter when it dried and would look too short.

So I trusted her.

I was wrong.

Kid looks like she barely got a haircut. Now we gotta go back 2 weeks later.

FAIL.

Thank god it only cost $12.

Ook!  R.I.P. Naked Chocolate Cafe.  You will be so very missed.  The new posseur in your places is awful.  Bitter coffee drinks.  A gorgeous but stale and hard-as-a-rock cranberry scone.

So disappointed.

I shall not return. I will be going across the street to Dunkin' for a fraction of the price and way better coffees.

We shopped here but ended up going with nearby Raymour & Flanigan.  Service was friendly enough and the salesfloor was CRAMMED with merchandise - a bit too cramped - so we rested on a couple of recliners.  We were looking for a couch and considered a model with 2 recliners built in.

I dunno it seemed too "cheap" in quality and price.  ASo I went with a more elegant piece - still mid price - at nearby Raymour & Flan.

This food court used to be much better.  It now has a saladworks, a chinese place, and Italian place, a cheap mexican place and is only open for lunch.

Super crowded.

I am not a fan.

Ordered only one thing and it failed.
I sure hope the sandwiches are as good as they sound on the menu.

Sweet potato fries.

Soggy.
Undersalted.
Bland.
Blah.

Not comin' back so fast.

Oh, poor Mother's.  You are passed your prime.  (And you've been a New Hope Main Street Stale for eons.)

We used to love brunch and or desserts here - but lately the food is just OK, and the decor (and restrooms) need a refresher.

Oh, dear.

MEh.  Raindrop ar posseur juice bars.  We need more places like they have in NYC that serve organic veggie juices - not slushies that all taste te same and have frozen pineapple in them.

The wheatgrass here is nit turned over rapidly enough and they have NO grapefruit juice.

It's what we're stuck with and I am thankful to have them in a pinch, but now... SQUEEZE in Comcast Center is saving my juicy day.

Meh.  I don't do costume.
Sorry.

But my 4 year old can spend 45-50 minutes in here playing and gawking like a kitten attracted to shiny, pretty objects.

It's a great way for me to entertain her for a while.
I'll even occaisionally buy her a trinket here - usually a bracelet.

It's kinda dingy-dirty in here - but hey - it's right near the Oreland Train Station and it has cigarettes, cold water & beverages and snacks.

We really NEED this place - so I hope the owner can spruce in up a bit and re-stock the shelves with less dusty items.

I think they also sell lottery tickets here.

It's your basic bodega - but in the burbs.

It is tempting for me to give a scathing review and few stars to Adsum, but I will preface this review by saying that I ate at Adsum as part of a large group event with a set meal (you can't please everybody).

That said, even with the limited (and Kosher-style) menu choices, Adsum really needs to ADD SOME (Some food, maybe?) to their restaurant.

I will also qualify my review by saying that the chef is very talented and was so gracious in speaking with our group.  (Why did you give a bunch of pork, clam and sausage (Lamb Merguez) based recipes to a JEWISH group??? Weird.) He really knows his stuff, though.  The service was also good (save for our new - 3 weeks only - server - who made a few bumbles along the way.)

We started with a choice of soup or salad.  I chose the 100% butter (or is it Bibb?) lettuce salad (absolutely no crunch, kinda limp feeling) with delicious asian pears and honey/cayenne candied nuts.  Crumbled of Maytag Bleu cheese on top and a delicious dressing (Sweet) with black sesame seeds. (This is where our server said they were peppercorns.  Sorry, not true.)
The salad - while good in concept was really boring and unsatisfying to eat.   Salade Ennuis.

Now I am hungry.

The entree was sized like a large app.  3 ricotta filled "gnuddi" (Think Gnocchi crossed with ravioli) were delicious sitting atop a zesty lemony-cream.  But the 6 small bites (about 2 per gnocchi) were not enough.  There was also (5 star!) one - just one - fried green tomato presented with an olive oil powder on top.  I got tons of the powder, while my friend next to me had a light dusting.  I think because my tomato had so much powder I could detect a slight "chemical aftertaste" from it.  (The "top note - was great - a dry, green olive oil.)

I would have bet money that somehow liquid nitrogen was involved. I'd have lost money.  They make the Olive oil powder by centrifuging the Olive oil with a malto-dexttin aggregate or something. Maybe that accounts for the chemical aftertaste?

I am getting over the whole "molecular gastronomy" fad very quickly.
I am also not a big lover of sous-vide (so much of it is done poorly), but that is the subject for another review.

The other entree choice was a single (JUST ONE) deep-fried cod fritter.  Not my bag, baby.

Delicious gnuddi - just not enough food.

Now I am STARVING...

So dessert comes, and it is GINORMOUS.  (Nice salad, tiny entree, huge hunk of chocolate cake) and so dense and cold and rich you can barely eat it with a spoon. My friend wanted a knife - as did I.)

So I ate 2 bites of the chocolate cake, and felt my blood sugar spike almost instantly.

Not fun.  I boxed up the rest for my 6 year old to enjoy later.

For $46 per person??  I guess that's fair - if you had eaten an actual entree. (Salad, app, huge dessert.)

I literally had to eat a bowl of strawberries at 11:30 PM when I got home. I hate eating late at night but I was absolutely famished.

I am very, very disappointed with Adsum.
That said - the regular menu (Foie gras poutine?  The SUPER Poutine is like a platter of pure fat in many forms.) doesn't really do it for me either.

Sorry Adsum.

FAIL. The 3 stars is so you won't hate me.  I am so tempted to give only 2.

Attended a conference here (again) and the conference functions were not adequately stocked with water.  The coffee/tea station was empty within minutes (over 150 people) and never re-filled.

3 stalls in the ladies room is NOT enough for a group of 150.  Many of us went downstairs (to another 3 star facility) and there was a (shorter) line there also.  And they reeked.  Stinky.  Eew.

That said the food was much improved for our luncheon.
Free wifi in the lobby area.

Sorry - but I loathe Cosi.
Yes, it's clean and comfortable to sit here - but the food and that bread are just awful.

The bread turns to rock after about 90 minutes of exposure to air, and after I eat it my stomach is truly upset.

Service is teen-age "meh" here.
4 stars for cleanliness and big comfy chairs.
Zero stars for awful food. A waste of $8.00.

Decidedly mediocre.  Overcooked salmon atop a boring salad.  Overly salted sides.  Meh. Meh. Meh.  Phooey.

Life is too short to eat formula cookery.

This is a review for the Deerhead Hot Dogs food truck.
The 2 guys working the truck were very pleasant, but FRANKly (pun in tended) they just could not handle our corporate lunch crowd.

I waited 25 minutes for my $7 lobster dog.
The lobster was fine but the cheese sauce was awful and the dog itself had been split and grilled - try BURNT to a blackened crisp.

I basically ate some lobster chunks and a tablespoon of greasy cheese-whiz-like sauce for lunch.

Better luck next time.
Next time, go to the store - not the truck.

Meh.
Uninspired, slightly dry pulled pork platter with a gloppy side of overly-cheesed mac (velveeta?) and a drink.

Luckily, I got a kids meal so it was less than $7 after tax.

Plenty of food in the kids meal - but a waste of Calories.
For a bit more money, I'd go to Mission - a bit closer to Plymouth Meeting Mall and spend more to get a better 'cue lunch.

Not in any hurry to rush back.

2 guys running the place were very nice.
Place was DEAD (me with a take out and one other dine-in person) at 12:15 PM on a Tuesday.
Not a good sign.

2-3 stars.

What in G-d's name possessed me?
I was hungry.  It was 9:30 PM on a Thursday night.
Where else could I go?

I sat at the bar and had inattentive service from the 22 year old over-worked, stressed out bartender.

I plowed my way through a very heavy cheese burger quesadilla.  (I felt righteous by not eating the fries.)  I left.

Not coming back unless someone else drags me here.

Blargh!

This place is kinda creepy.  It's a luncheonette style counter and serves greasy burgers and junky-cheap lunch food.  I went here exactly once and will never return.  I am tempted to give 1 star, due to the nasty-creepy-skeevy vibe, but I feel kinda generous today so I will give 2 stars.

Food was just Meh. (But it is very inexpensive and quick.)

We stopped in last night (a MONDAY) when we discovered that DOMA was closed on Mondays.

I had not been back to Swanky Bubbles in about 2 years - and things are not nearly as good as I remember.  The prices are higher, the sushi is "meh" and the lobster/crab mac 'n cheese tasted fishy and reminded me of a $24 tuna casserole.

The $8.00 4 piece "Rain Forest" roll (vegetarian) came with a wasabi cream that I swear was whisked wasabi mayo.

Meanwhile food was a 2 star and service about 4.
Dave, the bartender was a swwetheart and treated our 5 year old like a princess.  She loved her (bland) lobster maki.

The best part?  Delicious chocolate fondue.
A downer?  STALE poundcake chunks and tasteless melon balls (who puts melon in fodue?  Some pineapple would have been nice.)

Next time we'll probably go elsewhere.

Yuck.  Sooooo not my thing.  I can kinda-sorta deal with a plain turkey sub on whole wheat.

There is little nutritional goodness to be had here.  I simply hate fast food.

But it is cheap.  (You get what you pay for.)

Crapplebee's.
My 9 year old loves it here - and thus, we sometimes go.
Oddly enough her 9 year old BFF's fam loves it here, too - so again - we are dragged here.

The service is actually pretty good if you come at an off- peak time (Crystal is a lovely server).  The food though?  Ech!

The kiddo & I shared a Two for $20 deal and I added $1 extra to get the 7 oz (tiny) steak.  I asked for it rare and it had absolutely no flavor other than salt.  The steamed white rice and brocolli were sitting in a pool of water on the plate.

Blech!

The overly fried and greasy boneless wing app drenched in a sticky-sickly-sweet sauce was all I ate and that was bad enough.

Lord help us!
There are so many better places to eat.  I only come here under duress.

Sorry.
Wanted to love this place but my 8 year old and I walked in - to a dead-empty store.

The doors were wide open on a sultry summer weekday afternoon and the shop is beautiful and the coolers were stocked with roses, iris, white hydrangea and stock.  Lovely.

No staff to greet us.
Place looked deserted,

Sign on the wall says "Nobody EVER gets to see the Man Behind the Curtain" (or some similar quote from the "Wizard of Oz").

We called out, "Hello?  Hello?"
No response.
So we walked out.

We'll try again another day and update this review accordingly.  I would like to have a relationship with a GOOD local florist, as Kremp's handles my Bucks County and Center City needs.

I hope Media Florist is up to the challenge!
They do have staff, don't they?

ook!  Alex - you write well but this Kmart is NOT 4 stars.  No way.  1 or 2 max.  Dirty, disorganized, and disinterested underpaid staff.

Not a fan - but I have come here in a pinch for household goods.

1 or 2 stars tops.

This K-Mart is so "ghetto" and the people who work here?  Well, don't even bother to TRY and get help.

In a dire emergency I have come here twice - once to get basic paper goods and cleaning supplies and once to TRY to see if they had any decent toddler clothing.

I really try to avoid coming here.

Long lines at the check out, too.  Could somebody please WORK here?  None of the employees do any work?  They stand around and chit chat while we all wait in the line.  Do something!  Open another register.

Pu-leeze!

Ook!  Really?  My kid's friends (and their parents) all love it here - but i just don't get it.   Strip mall decor and "meh" service with bland pizza on a too-thick (for me) flabby crust that does NOT taste like NYC pizza one bit.

I have had better at Season's!  (And worse, too - to be fair).

Maybe the non-pizza items are better?  But I am not rushing back to try again.

Not impressed, Pappone's.

I only eat at Chili's when my friend (who loves it - why, I will never know) drags me here.  So last night we dines here - my first time to this location in 8 years.  We got the 2 for $25 - shared an app of onion petals, I had baby back ribs and she got chicken fajitas.

Dessert she took home - we were too full to eat it.

The best part?  Dinner for 2 with tax, tip and 2 soft drinks was $40.40.
The worst part?  That food is so salty - it's like a sodium bomb.

Kudos to our server Mahnyah who was working her tail off - she was so friendly and great - unlike the aloof and disinterested hostesses.

The service here in general needs an upgrade.

Avoid if possible and take your blood pressure meds.
Chili's is not for me!

I am fairly certain this is the correct location of Papa John's that we order from.  My 6 year old loves the plain pizza here and pepperoni.
I find it to be cardboard-like with plasticky cheese.  And a weird garlic margarine comes with it.  Eeeew.

She hates the sausage and finds it "too spicy".

Meanhwile I am unimpressed - I ate a salad.
Thankful they deliver, though.

Well, the Boat House has clearly "jumped the shark".  It's hey-day long over, fading decor and aging facilities along with a "typical" fried-seafood menu.  (Bar food with shrimp, fish and clams added.)

Service was fine - but we were asked if we wanted to eat on plastic plates because - as our server mentioned - "The Dishwasher isn't doing his job".  Eew.  So we opted for the disposable plates.  Weird.

Rumor has it this place is closing soon - and I can certainly see why.
I would never go back here.
Perhaps years go this was a "happening place" but not any more.
Rest in piece.

So awful it makes the Warrington Chuck E. Cheese's look like paradise.
We had our DD's 4th birthday party here about 2 years ago, and came back here on July 2, 2011 during the July 4th weekend madness.

After trying unsuccesfully to use the broken credit card machine to pay for $10 worth of tokens (There was a long line for tickets and tokens)  I succumbed and boought them at the counter.

It was DEAFENING in there and 3 of the machines DD tried to play were broken.  The manager was summoned and agreed to give us a refund.

Not happy!

Fortunately my kid will grow out of this phase of life very soon.

AVOID on holiday weekends!

Giggleberry staff:  FIX YOUR MACHINES!!!!

Holy smokes, it's hot as blazes in here!
All those freezer cases in a tiny cramped (dirty) space.

Service is slow as molasses - but they are trying.
For Dining under the Stars - they had ONE person in addition to the kind but over-worked owner.

Cash only.

Meanhwhile my year old ADORES this place.
We've stopped in here a few times to grab sodas (and gas - but we usually go to a different place for cheaper gas).  It sure ain't Wawa, but it's nice to have it around when you need it.

They still serve the most awful, bitter tasting olive oil to dip the bread in.  Don't do it!!!!
Our server was sub par - and dod not get us items like napkins/cultery, sweetener (for my $3.75 teeny-tiny cappucino) until asked.

Food was OK - but so SALTY - seriously, people - tone it down (the meatball "small plate" and pasta sauce are over salted.)!

Not a fan - and not rushing back here.

Why oh Why do i keep coming here?  The service is painfully slow - and there were only 2 people in the line (one lady ahead of me and then me).  It took about 7 minutes to get a toasted bagel with butter.

And I asked her to cut it in half (sometimes they do, sometimes they don't) and when I got to my office - not cut in half.

And Britney (sp?) the morning cashier is soooooo not into working.  You can tell she'd rather be elsewhere.

Oh - and a bagel with cc and (g-d forbid) tomato is over $3.00.

YOUCH!

Not gonna come back for a while.  It's a shame because 2 of their bagel flavors (Rosemary Olive Oil and Cinnamon Sugar) I find very good.  A whole lot better then the rat-infested Au Bon Pain down the block.

Please step up your service and lower your prices (even by 10 cents would help).

I have definitely had better - this place is a mix of Halal, Fried CHicken, Pizza and Indian dishes and seems to get none of them quite right.  Very cheap - $6 for lamb platter over rice - but lamb was dry and stringy.

I may try again - but not rushing back,

It's OK - as Kmarts go.  I am glad its around though - for cheap kids clothing, pullups and paper products.

It's kind of an emergency only place for me.

Again, as Kmarts go this one is clean and relatively well staffed.  They also were very nice about accepting a product return we had one time.  We used to stop here more when the SuperFresh was open in the same strip mall, but alas, the Superfresh has closed.

Just not my bag, baby.
Formula cooking by disinterested college kids - wearing "flare".

So not my thing.

It's OK - the one in Doylestown (not the same owners - at least i don't think so...) is better.  Allessio had italian sandwiches, salads and pasta dishes.  It is right on 611 and the traffic to get in & out can be tricky.

It's really not that good.  It's also quite affordable.

Sorry.

I do not like this chain at all!
This one is marginally better than the hellish one in Doylestown.

The Gyro is a joke.
The tortilla I had was cold.

Not good.
Chipotle and Qdoba are better for "fast food Mex".

Uck!

Cool things:  Cheap prices, wall of hot sauces and "mix your own" soda flavors.

Otherwise - I'll pass.

Had a very mediocre $13 lunch here.
It was summer - so the place was nearly empty.

Age-Dashi Tofu was cut into 2 HUGE chunks and swimming in dashi.
That was (sadly) the best part of the meal.

Beef Bi-Bim Bap had very little meat that was nearly flavorless. 
Not great at all.

Will not be back.

You're kidding? Far from as good as it gets.
This store is disorganized and often out of stock of the MSM/Chondroitin supplements I buy.
Prices are high (except during an amazing 30% off everything in the store event that was great) and staff seems disinterested.

Messy floors. Please sweep them.
Please re-stock your shelves.

The good part?  They do have alot of the things I need - like Eukaneuba Small Breed Dry food and the aforementioned Joint Care supplements.

Not my favorite pet store - but it is closets to my home and I am thankful they are here.

Very Upset.
Since my initial review - which was terrific - we have been here several times.  Each time the food quality was a bit worse - maybe 3 stars.

But this last time - now I am so angry,
I cam in at about 4:15 PM and was hungry so I got 2 garlic knots to go for my kid and asked the (albeit young and feisty, but apparently clueless) counter gal how much a side order of the chicken tortellini would be.  She said $2.99 and I said "fine".

Got to the cashier (same manager guy as before) and he rings up my order at nearly $7 - and I'm like "What??".  He says it's $4.99 for the chicken tortellini.  I reluctantly agree and pay for it.
I sit down and start to eat it and it tastes slightly sour.  Then more sour.  I threw half of it away and walked out.

I will not return unless my kid demands it.

I bet that had been sitting out since lunchtime - and shame on me for ordering it.

NOT COOL, Bravo Pizza.  Not cool at all!

Not nearly as bad as I had feared.
Room was satisfactory.
"Hotel" Food at the event I attended was fine.  Not awesome - but perfectly good.

Check-in/out went smoothly.

They even have an indoor pool (wish I had known - I did not bring a swimsuit).

I stayed here for a corporate event, otherwise would not have picked this location.
Female bartender in "Blue" lounge was a doll.

Oh - a BIG thing - please fix:  NASTY SMELL in lobby and elevator.

It's just too darned expensive.  Yes, they have nice clothes for babies and kids.  Yes, they have cute gift ideas and upscale toys.

No I will not spend $256 on a wooden rocking horse nor will I spend $54 reduced from $180 on a bikini for a 2 year old.

Sorry.

TCT. (TCCT)
Typical Chinese (cheap) Takeout.

greasy, fast, inexpensive - especially for lunch specials - I had Tofu w/ Mix. Veg. - light on the sauce which was a smart move.

2 Spring rolls (grease fest) for $1.85.

Desparate times called for quick lunch.
This place looks like it has been here for years - and could use a new menu board (pictures are ancient) and a good cleaning.

Take out only - or eat on one of the 2 greasy tables..

Mediocre food and truly awful management.
There was a private event upstairs and we were told TWICE that all ages were welcomed - but it is a BAR and 21 and under are not allowed upstairs.

We wound up dining in a booth downstairs and our server Cindy was the best part of the night - she was terrific, but the manager?  Just awful.
So rude.

In the mean time the $8 chicken fingers and $5 side salad were fine.
Nothing to write home about,

Nope.  Tried again as my 13 year old loves it here and loves Poke and Sashimi in general.

Fish is just not fresh enough and the $8.95 "regular" sized bowl has so little fish anyway.  She got salmon and added avocado ($1 extra).
The greens are not my favorite - I like romaine over spring mix, but most people disagree.

Anyhow, I will not return for me but if kiddo wants it, I will get it.

Unsatisfied.

Also - it was so LOUD in there I could barely hear myself think.

Get takeout.

Meh.
Smells like faint cigarette smoke with artificial rose air freshener sprayed over top in the hallways (fortunately room smelled ok).

Very dark, dated looking rooms with dark brown furniture and fixture.
Clean bathroom.  No major issues.

Cheap.
Hard to access (on a busy divided highway) but close to Longwood Gardens, Brandywine Museum and other area attractions.

Meh.

Not horrible but not great.

Incredibly mediocre.
I have never been an Uno fan - but recent visits (dragged there by my chain-loving in-laws) were surprisingly good, at the Warrington, PA location.

Today's early lunch with a co-worker was a last minute decisions and the place was nearly empty when we arrived at 11:40 AM.  Even still service was painfully slow.

We both ordered off the "super fast" (10 minutes or less) lunch menu and both ordered nearly the same thing - salads with 2 sliders. After about 13 minutes we got fidgety, and finally EVERYTHING came out at once.

Salad was on rusty lettuce (I opted for the Garden Salad as I feared the Caesar would be only romaine and croutons) with ONE tomato wedge and ONE Slice of cucumber.  Oy.

Sliders were OK but VERY salty (due to the cheddar cheese).

Would NOT order this $7.99 deal ever again.
Server admitted to us she was exhausted from the night before.

Sorry, UNO, today's lunch was a fail.

Totally average.  Not clean, not dirty.
Not good, not bad.
Not tasty, not yucky.

Just 
Plain
MEH.

Was dragged here by a rich coworker who "just loves" it here. Blargh. My $14 salad was just ok at best and they have no creamy dressings, only 1001 vinaigrettes. Yes, they are house made, but I wanted a non vinaigrette.

The lettuce mix was very cabbage-heavy. 

My lunch turned out to be $22 including tax and tip and it was unsatisfactory and unsatisfying. 

So upset.

A total dive - with decent (mediocre) greassy, fairly thick-crusted, Neapolitan-style pie.
It was one of the FIRST original pizza joints from "back in the day",

Believe me - back then they were awesome - simply because the choices were so very limited.

So anyhow, I am glad they are still in business - but somehow I can't believe that they are.

A MAKEOVER is needed. Stat.

I was thrilled to see my local Giant (in Aston, PA) carried Talluto's frozen beef ravioli and I caved and bought a dozen (1 box) for $7.99.

They were so salty (570 mg of sodium per 4 rav serving) the filling was nearly inedible.  I ate the pasta (tender yet firm and so good) but de-filled them.

Sad.

Ate here out of desparation and a lack of knowledge.
Mediocre at best.  Overly salt and fat laden garbage.
Hey, it's inexpensive and very filling - and many people love it here - but I just don't.

Nope.

Never again.

Very disappointed in the flavorless, dry black quinoa salad that set me back $10 for lunch.  Also had an OK $3.00 Arnold Palmer.  The quinoa salad at Pure Fare (and even the frozen Quinoa Bowls I get at Whole Foods) are far superior and cheaper.

Not a fan of this place any more.
Over-priced and not that good.

I should have stuck with the green submarine (glad it's still on the menu).
Skip this place and go elsewhere for a better lunch for less money.

I'm sorry but I hate shopping at this Acme, and Acme in general.
This branch is near the old Granite Run Mall - now a construction site for a new shopping center.

While I am happy to see that Acme employs disabled people, the check out lines are painfully, painfully slow.  Freindly, but slow.

Selection is average.
Cleanliness just average.

Not my go to.

After reading these reviews before my stay (I could not change locations due to an event I was attending at the Crowne Plaza) I prepared for the worst.

It was not nearly as awful as I feared BUT  (there is a big butt!)...
While the room was clean-ish (I brought my own pillow and case) and did not skeeve me out too badly, the communal restroom on the lobby level is awful.

The entire foyer of the "Grand" ballroom (it ain't so grand) smelled like sewage.  When we complained a commercial grade air-freshener was sprayed make it smell like...  Sewage and Air Freshener.

I was astounded at the number of high school proms, weddings and corporate events that are held here.  The place is truly bad.
No way I would book my own event here.  And no WAY I would get married here.

Bad. Bad. Bad.

In fact, I have been to (another) Champps before - and I knew it would likely be bad - but a co-worker wanted to come here so I reluctantly agreed.

We were "greeted" (sighed at) by 2 very surly hostesses.  The place was nearly empty at 4:50 PM on a Wednesday night.   One of the hostesses led us to a "high top" in the noisy bar area (Noisy from TV's blaring - very few customers).  We asked to be moved to a "regular" table in the dining area and she shot us a dirty look and then led us over there.

Horrible service by the hostesses.

Meanwhile, our "jolly" male server was quite good.  We ordered lunch portions (even at dinner time!) of the cobb salad and iced teas.

Salads were fresh but "blah".  Not great and not bad - but very low on the protein (Chicken, Shrimp or Salmon).  I upgraded to shrimp for $2 and got about 5 medium sized shrimp.  I wished there were more.

The lunch portion is, indeed, small.  I left hungry, unsatisfied and felt the entire place could use a good cleaning (Carpets are grungy, bathroom was filthy and toilets do not flush properly.)

The teenagers running the place do. not. care.

Uninspired.  Uninspiring.

Avoid.

My 8 year old avid crafter loves Michael's, AC Moore and JoAnnes Fabrics - and we visit various locations of each.  This one has Deplorable service.  (Average for cleanliness and variety/price of items - but Non-existent service).

The manager had no idea what "washi tape" (crafting/scrapbooking tape even was and said that they did not carry any "colorful" tape for scrapbooking - only clear tape - but she said we could "try in aisle 3 A" - so we did and there was a HUGE display of tons of the stuff - so we snapped up a few rolls.

Odd, odd, odd place.

But they're near our home - so w'll be back.

Horrible service, filthy bathrooms, mediocre food and just not worth it in any way.

Perhaps I should give them 1 star but the side order of brussels sprouts was good.

That ladies room was so nasty - they floors were awful and 2 toilets were clogged.

Yick.

I have lost my appetitie.

It's still bad.  Service is so slow. Prices are better at Giant.
Better meats at Acme though - but the produce is pricey and "meh".

I shop at Giant in Aston, Trader Joe's, Whole Paycheck and Gentile's for Produce.

Acme is a last resort and everytime I shop here it's out of desparation (Acme is the closest grocery store to my house.)

That said, when my kid was little they let her girl scout troop sell cookies here and Giant wouldn't.

They employ great people with diabilities but my inner-Manhattanite can't handle the slow, slow pace.

Not a fan of Acme.

I think I am too old to even be allowed entry to H & M. 

This is the epitome of disposable fashion.  Cheaply made, inexpensive clothes for YOUNG, thin gals who need to change outfits often.
My fat size 8 (or 10 on a bad day) is a rarity here.  So if you are a stick you may have better luck.

Good for club gear - not so good for my corporate America lifestyle.

The shoes are truly awful  (Felt flats??  eew.)

Ook. Went here about 3 years ago for a "Happy Hour" sponsored by the Temple Law Association.  This place was on par with Public House aka "the Pube".  Icky.

Bad crowd, watery drinks, mediocre bar snacks and a sort of a "I miss being a frat boy" vibe.

Not goin' back.

Nope.

I strongly disagree with Veruca - this is "Mall Chinese" and just OK.
